alert.note: Alert for Fairfax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 04 at 1:11AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff from earlier rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Virginia, including the following county: Fairfax. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 108 AM EDT, Localized rainfall amounts around 1 to 3 inches fell within an hour or two. The heaviest rain has ended, but excess runoff from the rainfall will cause some streams to rise out of their banks overnight into early Tuesday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Annandale... Springfield... Vienna... Mantua... Fort Belvoir... Oakton... Lincolnia... Tysons Corner... Lorton... Franconia... Wolf Trap... Merrifield... Newington... I395 and I495 Interchange... I66 and I495 Interchange... West Springfield... Mount Vernon... Dunn Loring... North Springfield... Hayfield... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
